0.name: # 0 - no Ab-initio model
0.comment: #			If Ab-initio model is not required

1.name: # 1 - EFS data should be provided
1.comment: #			Used if driver provides EFS data with configurations. No additional EFS calculation is performed

r_min.name: Abinitio:LJ:r_min
r_min.comment: # <double>	Distance to minimum of pair function (in Angstroms)

scale.name: Abinitio:LJ:scale
scale.comment: # <double>	Value of pair function in minimum (in eV)

3.name: # 3 - VASP
3.comment: #			Use DFT model by VASP. Linking via files exchange

POSCAR.name: Abinitio:VASP:POSCAR
POSCAR.comment: # <string>	Hint: Path can be specified here

OUTCAR.name: Abinitio:VASP:OUTCAR
OUTCAR.comment: # <string>	Hint: Path can be specified here

Start_command.name: Abinitio:VASP:Start_command
Start_command.comment: # <string>	Command to environment for starting VASP (Hint: it can be usefull to specify here the command for launching a script that launches VASP)

4.name: # 4 - LAMMPS
4.comment: #			Use potentials clculating by LAMMPS. Linking via files exchange

Input_file.name: Abinitio:LAMMPS:Input_file
Input_file.comment: # <string>	File with configuration to be read by lammps

Output_file.name: Abinitio:LAMMPS:Output_file
Output_file.comment: # <string>	File with configuration and EFS data to be read by MLIP

Start_command.name: Abinitio:LAMMPS:Start_command
Start_command.comment: # <string>	Command to environment for starting LAMMPS (Hint: it can be usefull to specify here the command for launching a script that launches LAMMPS)

MLIP.name: mlip
MLIP.comment: # <string>	Filename with MTP. If not specified driver operates directly with Ab-Initio model (without additional routines)

Calculate_EFS.name: calculate-efs
Calculate_EFS.comment: # <bool>	Enables/disables EFS calculation by MTP (disabled learning may be usefull in pure learning/selection regime for best performance)

Save.name: mlip:fit:save
Save.comment: # <string>	Output MTP file name (for trained MTP)

Energy_equation_weight.name: mlip:fit:energy-weight
Energy_equation_weight.comment: # <double>	Weight for energy equation in fitting procedure

Forces_equation_weight.name: mlip:fit:force-weight
Forces_equation_weight.comment: # <double>	Weight for forces equations in fitting procedure

Stress_equation_weight.name: mlip:fit:stress-weight
Stress_equation_weight.comment: # <double>	Weight for stresses equations in fitting procedure

Relative_forces_weight.name: mlip:fit:scale-by-force
Relative_forces_weight.comment: # <double>	If greater than zero, large forces will be fitted less accurate than small

Fit_log.name: mlip:fit:log
Fit_log.comment: # <string>	Where to write fitting log. No logging if not specified; if "stdout" and "stderr" corresponds to standard output streams; otherwise log will be outputed to file with that name

Site_E_weight.name: MLIP:Select:Site_E_weight
Site_E_weight.comment: # <double>	Weight for site energy equations in selection procedure

Energy_weight.name: MLIP:Select:Energy_weight
Energy_weight.comment: # <double>	Weight for energy equation in selection procedure

Forces_weight.name: MLIP:Select:Forces_weight
Forces_weight.comment: # <double>	Weight for forces equations in selection procedure

Stress_weight.name: MLIP:Select:Stress_weight
Stress_weight.comment: # <double>	Weight for stresses equations in selection procedure

Threshold_slct.name: MLIP:Select:Threshold_slct
Threshold_slct.comment: # <double>	Selection threshold - maximum allowed extrapolation level

Save_TS.name: MLIP:Select:Save_TS
Save_TS.comment: # <string>	Selected configurations will be saved in this file after selection is complete. No configuration saving if not specified

Save_state.name: MLIP:Select:Save_state
Save_state.comment: The state of the selection will be saved in this file after selection is complete. No saving if not specified. Can be used for further continue selection/learning on the fly

Load_state.name: MLIP:Select:Load_state
Load_state.comment: # <string>	The state of the selection will be loaded from this file before selection starts. No saving if not specified. Used to continue selection/learning on the fly

Select_log.name: MLIP:Select:Log
Select_log.comment: # <string>	Where to write selection log. No logging if not specified; if "stdout" and "stderr" corresponds to standard output streams; otherwise log will be outputed to file with that name

EFSviaMTP.name: MLIP:LOTF:EFSviaMTP
EFSviaMTP.comment: # <bool>	"0" - pass to driver ab-initio EFS while LOTF when learning occurs, "1" - only MTP-calculated EFS will be passed to driver. (Works only in LOTF regime)

Log.name: MLIP:LOTF:Log
Log.comment: # <string>	Where to write log of learning on the fly process. No logging if not specified; if "stdout" and "stderr" corresponds to standard output streams; otherwise log will be outputed to file with that name

Check_errors.name: MLIP:Check_errors
Check_errors.comment: # <bool>	"1" enables comparison and accumulation of error statistics for EFS calculated by ab-initio model and MTP. Requires specified ab-initio model

Check_errors_log.name: MLIP:Check_errors:Log
Check_errors_log.comment: # <string>	Where to write log of learning on the fly process. No logging if not specified; if "stdout" and "stderr" corresponds to standard output streams; otherwise log will be outputed to file with that name

Write_cfgs.name: write-cfgs
Write_cfgs.comment: # <string>	File for writing all processed configurations. No confuguration recording if not specified

Skip_N.name: MLIP:Write_cfgs:Skip_N
Skip_N.comment: # <int>	Skip this number of configurations while writing

Log.name: MLIP:Log
Log.comment: # <string>	Where to write MLIP log. No logging if not specified; if "stdout" and "stderr" corresponds to standard output streams; otherwise log will be outputed to file with that name

load_from.name: mlip:load-from
load_from.comment: # <string>      Filename with MTP. If not specified driver operates directly with Ab-Initio model (without additional routines)

Driver.name: driver
Driver.comment: # <0-2>		Defines the configuration driver. Makes no sense if external driver is attached

0.name: # 0 - no driver or external MD driver (e.g. LAMMPS)

Max_count.name: Driver:Database:Max_count
Max_count.comment: # <int>		Maximal number of configurations to read

Database_log.name: driver:cfg-reader:log
Database_log.comment: # <string>	 Where to write reading log. No logging if not specified; if "stdout" and "stderr" corresponds to standard output streams; otherwise log will be outputed to file with that name

Pressure.name: Driver:Relaxation:Pressure
Pressure.comment: # <double>	External pressure (in GPa). If not zero enthalpy is minimized

Iteration_limit.name: Driver:Relaxation:Iteration_limit
Iteration_limit.comment: # <int>		Maximal number of iteration of the relaxation process

Forces_tolerance.name: Driver:Relaxation:Forces_tolerance
Forces_tolerance.comment: # <double>	Forces on atoms in relaxed configuration should be smaller than this value (in eV/Angstroms). Zero or negative value disables atoms relaxation (changing fractional coordinates of atoms)

Stress_tolerance.name: Driver:Relaxation:Stress_tolerance
Stress_tolerance.comment: # <double>	Stresses in relaxed configuration should be smaller than this value (in GPa). Zero or negative value disables supercell relaxation (changing lattice vectors of the supercell)

Max_step.name: Driver:Relaxation:Max_step
Max_step.comment: # <double>	Maximal allowed displacement of atoms and lattice vectors in Cartesian coordinates (in Angstroms)

Min_step.name: Driver:Relaxation:Min_step
Min_step.comment: # <double>	Minimal displacement of atoms and lattice vectors in Cartesian coordinates (in Angstroms). If allactual displacemnts are lesser than relaxation stops

BFGS_Wolfe_C1.name: Driver:Relaxation:BFGS_Wolfe_C1
BFGS_Wolfe_C1.comment: # <double>	Wolfe condition constant on the function decrease (linesearch stopping criterea)

BFGS_Wolfe_C2.name: Driver:Relaxation:BFGS_Wolfe_C2
BFGS_Wolfe_C2.comment: # <double>	Wolfe condition constant on the gradient decrease (linesearch stopping criterea)

Save_relaxed.name: Driver:Relaxation:Save_relaxed
Save_relaxed.comment: # <string>	Filename for output results of relxation (configurations). No configuration will be saved if not specified

Relaxation_log.name: Driver:Relaxation:Log
Relaxation_log.comment: # <string>	Where to write relaxation log. No logging if not specified; if "stdout" and "stderr" corresponds to standard output streams; otherwise log will be outputed to file with that name
